metadata.subject: Fwd: 'Atlas Shrugged': From Fiction to Fact in 52 Years

relationships.description: Sender and recipient of original email

analysis.purpose: To share a political commentary article comparing current economic policies to Ayn Rand's 'Atlas Shrugged'
analysis.significance: Shows ideological perspective on government economic policies during financial crisis era

notable_quotes: 'Politicians invariably respond to crises -- that in most cases they themselves created -- by spawning new government programs, laws and regulations.'
'The more incompetent you are in business, the more handouts the politicians will bestow on you.'
'When profits and wealth and creativity are denigrated in society, they start to disappear -- leaving everyone the poorer.'

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present - this is political commentary being shared

illegal_activity.description: Document contains a forwarded news article commentary about economic policy and Ayn Rand's philosophy, not first-hand illegal activity

details: Stephen Moore article from Wall Street Journal
Reference to potential 'Atlas Shrugged' movie adaptation

public_knowledge.context: This is a Wall Street Journal opinion piece about Ayn Rand's political philosophy and comparisons to contemporary economic policies during the 2008 financial crisis

analysis.summary: A forwarded email containing a Wall Street Journal opinion piece by Stephen Moore that compares contemporary government economic policies and bailouts to the themes in Ayn Rand's novel 'Atlas Shrugged', arguing that current policies mirror the destructive government interventions depicted in the fictional work.
